alert.note: Alert for Bailey; Cochran; Lamb (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 27 at 10:26PM CDT until May 27 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHERN BAILEY, NORTHERN COCHRAN AND SOUTHWESTERN LAMB COUNTIES... At 1026 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported flooding on FM 596 at the "S" curve in Cochran County, FM 597 east of highway 214 in Cocrahn County, and portions of highway 214 in southern Bailey County. Between 0.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Morton, Sudan, Needmore, Muleshoe Wildlife Refuge, Enochs, Bula and Maple. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
